recipe.title: Meatballs
recipe.description: This is a great meal that will be very sucessful at the next potluck. It is a traditional swedish dish that is served at every IKEA in the world. The legend says that the meatball originates from Turkey and was brought to Sweden in the 18th century.

recipetext.li: Mix milk and bread crumbs. Let swell for 10 minutes. Add ground meat, onion, egg, salt, black pepper, and sugar to the bread crumb mix. Work the mix.
Moist the hands with cold water and form the meat balls. Fry a couple at a time in cooking oil, shake the pan at regular intervals so that the meatballs roll around and keeps it's round shape.
Serve the meatballs with boiled potatoes or mashed potatoes and lingonberry jam.

recipe.title: Pancakes
recipe.description: This recipe is so delicious and easy to make. Serve with butter and maple syrup, or lingonberries if you've got them. A really classic Swedish traditional course!

ingredient.li: jam, berries or fruit for serving

recipetext.li: Mix flour and salt in a bowl. Whip the mixture while poring in halve of the milk and mix until it is a smooth batter. Mix in the rest of the milk and the eggs.
Melt the butter in a frying pan and pour batter into the pan. Fry thin pancakes.
Serve with jam, berries or fruit.
